title: Calories in 6 oz Sirloin Steak
meta_description: Learn calories in 6oz sirloin steak, with a full nutrition profile including protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for different preparations.
assumptions: Lean top sirloin steak, grilled, trimmed of visible fat, no added oil, salt, or marinades; cooked to medium.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and portion accuracy. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: A 6 oz grilled sirloin steak provides ~301 kcal and ~52 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for cooking per 100 g
Include visible fat trim (not removed) per 100 g
Pan-seared with butter (1 tsp per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 6 oz sirloin steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 301 kcal for a lean, grilled 6 oz portion.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 6 oz sirloin steak?
faqs.a: About 52 g of protein, making it a high-protein choice.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain grilled sirloin steak.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in sirloin steak?
faqs.a: Grilling keeps it lower; frying or adding oil can add 40-50 kcal per 100 g.
Yes, ~10 g total fat for lean cuts, with 4 g saturated.
